index.name: angularjs
index.subtitle: AngularJS
index.about: AngularJS is a toolset for building the framework most suited to your application development. It is fully extensible and works well with other libraries. Every feature can be modified or replaced to suit your unique development workflow and feature needs.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about AngularJS framework.

videos.title: Building Realtime Apps With Firebase and Angular
videos.description: In this talk you'll learn about how to use Firebase and Angular together and learn why building a modern realtime app will never be the same again.

videos.title: Using AngularJS to create iPhone & Android applications with PhoneGap
videos.description: This talk will we cover Setup of a PhoneGap (Apache Cordova) project using the AngularJS framework using npm, bower, grunt & cordova. Directory structure for a sample AngularJS application Compilation to iOS with Xcode & Android with Eclipse ADT.

videos.title: Angular with Browserify
videos.description: This session will introduce Browserify and the CommonJS module format, discuss the benefits they provide, and demonstrate how to utilize those benefits in the context of an Angular app.

videos.title: Robotics powering interfaces with AngularJS to the Arduino
videos.description: In this talk, we'll discuss the power of the arduino to interface software with the rest of our human experience. We'll discuss the real-time nature of the arduino and how we can surface the sensor data through a real-time interface.

videos.title: Angular Performance
videos.description: In this talk, you'll learn some tips to build an optimized angular app, exploring best practices and diagnosing performance problems.

videos.title: Building an Angular App: Introduction
videos.description: In this lesson, we introduce our sample AngularJS application and discuss our objectives for this series.

videos.title: Building an Angular App: Bootstrapping
videos.description: In this lesson, we learn how to take a static HTML page and tap into the power of AngularJS by bootstrapping the framework.

videos.title: Building an Angular App: Filters
videos.description: We are going to learn how to filter our bookmarks based on the selected category. We will learn how to manage the current category in the controller as well as set the current category from the view.

videos.title: Building an Angular App: Controllers
videos.description: We are going to take the static HTML elements and dynamically display them on the page by setting up an AngularJS controller and hooking it up with AngularJS templating in the view.

videos.title: Directive Definition Object (DDO)
videos.description: Directive Definition Objects are used to configure AngularJS directives.

videos.title: $apply vs $digest
videos.description: $apply and $digest are both methods on AngularJS scopes that allow you to manually trigger the updates to bound properties on your scopes.

videos.title: Using ngModel in Custom Directives
videos.description: You can use ngModel in your own directives, but there are a few things you'll need to do to get it working properly.

videos.title: Protractor Interactive
videos.description: Did you know that Protractor has a handy interactive mode to help with writing/debugging your end-to-end (e2e) tests?

videos.title: Introduction to Grunt for Angular
videos.description: Task automation is critical for any AngularJS single-page application. Grunt gets the job done.

videos.title: Using $resource for Data Models
videos.description: In this video, Brett will show you the basics of using $resource, as well as talking about some of the drawbacks with using this service for your data models.

videos.title: Model Validation Design Review
videos.description: We want robust validation for our AngularJS models. This will require a bit of forethought, and this lesson will examine the goals that we have for the validation piece of our model library.

videos.title: Hands-on Angular Front-end Setup
videos.description: In this lesson, we'll set up the Angular front-end application with the help of Yeoman. We'll learn the structure of the application and the cool things Yeoman provides out of the box like testing and LiveReload.
